xxl.core.util
Class DatabaseAccess

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.util.DatabaseAccess

public class DatabaseAccess
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains all neccessary information to connect to a database. This information (name of the driver, username, password and URL of the database) can be stored and retained from a property file. This class does not implement any security issues. The password is stored inside a String.

Example for a property file: 

        driver=sun.jdbc.odbc.JdbcOdbcDriver
        url=jdbc:odbc:testdb
        askForPassword=false

Field Detail

ASK_FOR_PW_CONSOLE

public static Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> ASK_FOR_PW_CONSOLE
Function which asks the user for a password via the command line. The function returns the password as a String.

Constructor Detail

DatabaseAccess

public DatabaseAccess(java.lang.String classname,
                      java.lang.String username,
                      java.lang.String password,
                      java.lang.String dburl,
                      boolean askForPassword,
                      Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> askForPasswordFunction)
Initialize the connection data explizitly.

Parameters:
classname - name of the class of the JDBC-driver
username - name of the user
password - password for the logon to the database
dburl - URL of the database
askForPassword - If no password is specified: should be asked for a password on the command line?
askForPasswordFunction - Function which asks the user to enter a password for the database. The function gets the url and the username as two parameters of type String.

DatabaseAccess

                      java.lang.String username,
                      java.lang.String password,
                      java.lang.String dburl,

Parameters:

username - name of the user
password - password for the logon to the database
dburl - URL of the database
askForPassword - If no password is specified: should be asked for a password on the command line?
Method Detail

loadFromPropertyFile

public static DatabaseAccess loadFromPropertyFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                                                  Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> askForPasswordFunction)
Creates a DatabaseAccess object and initializes it with the data from a property file. The names of the properties have to be "driver", "user", "password", "url" and "askForPassword".

Parameters:
fileName - name of the file with the property information.
askForPasswordFunction - Function which asks the user to enter a password for the database. The function gets the url and the username as two parameters of type String.
Returns:
DatabaseAccess object created

storePropertyFile

public void storePropertyFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                              java.lang.String header)
Stores the information about the connection in a property file.

Parameters:
fileName - Name of the property file
header - if this argument is not null, then an ASCII # character, the header string, and a line separator are first written to the output stream. Thus, this header can serve as an identifying comment.
